title: 18-Year-Old Halima Hadi Alfina Becomes One of the Youngest Hajj Pilgrims in 2024
text:
Halima Hadi Alfina, an 18-year-old Indonesian girl, has achieved a significant milestone by becoming one of the youngest
Hajj pilgrims in 2024. Her path to this accomplishment began at an early age, showcasing her determination and financial discipline.
Halima's story is one of early ambition and perseverance. She started saving money for her
Hajj pilgrimage when she was just a kindergarten student in 2009. Although her parents registered her for the pilgrimage at that time, she did not fully grasp its significance until she grew older. As she entered her teenage years, her determination to save for the pilgrimage intensified.
A talented dancer, Halima has been performing since childhood. She saved her earnings from dance performances and competitions, keeping only a small portion for charity. "Since I was in PAUD (early childhood education), I've been part of a dance troupe. I would save my dance earnings, and my mom would keep them for my Hajj fund," Halima shared in an interview with Media Center Haji (MCH) at Masjid Nabawi on May 25, 2024.
Why this matters: Halima's achievement serves as a model for young people to prioritize their goals and develop financial discipline from an early age. This mindset can have a positive impact on their future careers and personal lives, leading to a more responsible and ambitious younger generation.
In addition to her dance earnings, Halima participated in various competitions outside of dance, winning several prizes that she added to her
Hajj fund. Her disciplined approach to managing her finances enabled her to save a substantial amount of money over the years.
Halima and her family originally planned to perform the
https://www.arabnews.com/node/2520326/saudi-arabia in 2020, but the COVID-19 pandemic delayed their plans until 2024. This setback, however, made Halima more independent, and she managed to cover her own expenses for the pilgrimage using her savings.
Halima's mother, Jumiyati, played a vital role in teaching her the importance of financial discipline from a young age. Jumiyati, a school principal in Semarang, emphasized the value of spending only on necessities. "If she asked for a new phone, for example, I would explain to her that she didn't need it, as her only need was for learning," Jumiyati explained.
Halima's remarkable achievement is a demonstration of her determination, discipline, and hard work. She is now pursuing her dream of becoming a
dentist and serves as an inspiration to young people everywhere.
Halima Hadi Alfina's path to becoming one of the youngest Hajj pilgrims in 2024 highlights the power of early ambition and financial discipline. Her story is a source of inspiration for young individuals aiming to achieve their dreams through dedication and hard work.
Key Takeaways
- 18-year-old Halima Hadi Alfina becomes one of the youngest Hajj pilgrims in 2024.
- She started saving for Hajj in 2009, at age 5, with her parents' support.
- Halima saved earnings from dance performances and competitions for her Hajj fund.
- She developed financial discipline from an early age, prioritizing savings over wants.
- Halima's achievement inspires young people to set goals and practice financial responsibility.
